revised_title: Spectrum Analysis and the Sun's Spectrum
tldr: The author investigates the effects of pressure and temperature on spectral lines using sodium vapor and demonstrates the importance of these findings in solar and stellar physics. The new method of observing spectra allows for the examination of minute portions of the sun and its surrounding atmosphere, revealing the thickening of Fraunhofer lines in solar spots and the thinning in the chromosphere and prominences.
